page.title: 04 Grove Park
page.content: { Grove park}used to be part of the private gardens that belonged to the Smyth-Pigott family; a very influential Weston family.In 1889 the family decided to lease the land to the town.Therefore the gardens were opened to the public and Grove Park opened on{20th June 1891. Grove house was an important part of the park, but it was bombed and mainly destroyed during the war.All that is left now are the gateways which used to be part of the coach house. Today Grove Park is a very popular place; with both holiday makers and Westoners.There are rockeries, waterfalls, a tennis court and a bandstand.Around the pond are the remains of statues which were bought by John Hugh Smyth-Pigott at the sale of Strawberry Hill.
